body_html:
Seems like a nice option for a future compiler optimization -- as @TimZaman said, I suspect this doesn't show up as a huge performance win yet, but these types of optimizations are definitely on our mind.

Btw, I would argue that when the user can't tell the difference, we should automatically do the optimization (e.g., if the only consumer of ReLU is MaxPooling -- no manual fetching or summaries, then it is probably safe to reorder them since the observed output is the same).
body_text:
Seems like a nice option for a future compiler optimization -- as @TimZaman said, I suspect this doesn't show up as a huge performance win yet, but these types of optimizations are definitely on our mind.
Btw, I would argue that when the user can't tell the difference, we should automatically do the optimization (e.g., if the only consumer of ReLU is MaxPooling -- no manual fetching or summaries, then it is probably safe to reorder them since the observed output is the same).
body:
Seems like a nice option for a future compiler optimization -- as @TimZaman said, I suspect this doesn't show up as a huge performance win yet, but these types of optimizations are definitely on our mind.

Btw, I would argue that when the user can't tell the difference, we should automatically do the optimization (e.g., if the only consumer of ReLU is MaxPooling -- no manual fetching or summaries, then it is probably safe to reorder them since the observed output is the same).
